result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera

records.addlTxt: Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul K Kuszel in court for Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Court orders $2500 cash bail, all previously ordered conditions remain. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul K Kuszel appeared by video for Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requested adjournment due to defendant recently revoked. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36; IN PERSON. Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera in court with attorney Julius Andriusis.  Defendant Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense is waiting for an offer from the State.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Paul Kuszel

Defendant Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera in court with Attorney Julius Andriusis; both appear by video.  Defendant Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer J. Birschbach. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Information was rejected as it contained Count 1 which was previously rejected. Matter is set for arraignment.   
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Arraignment scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 070375,
Payable Number: 1022182,
Receipt Number: 22RP030117,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with EDK,;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jaime V Curbelo-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defense motions to dismiss case due to lack of details in the identifying language of the criminal complaint. Court dismisses count 1 without prejudice. Court denies dismissal of count 2. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
